title: Were the Germanic tribes often stronger than the Romans? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Romans came up face to face with the Nervii tribe in 57 BC who were taller and fought viciously. However the Roman legions formed a phalanx, and first of all fired a thin spear of soft iron which when stuck in the enemy shield bent and made the shield useless. The Romans proceeded to cut down the Nervii with their short swords until they had killed so many of the Nervii the bodies were piled six feet high. this Roman method of combat was hard to beat and was nearly always successful. The battle of Teutoburg forest was completetly different. The three legions were strung out through the German forest led by Arminius and were forced into single combat which devastated the Romans as they could not form a phalanx and thus all Three legions were beaten. They were led by Publius Quincctilius Varus who along withe some other survivors committed suicide. The battle lasted four days and 20,000 Roman soldiers were killed. This showed the superiority of single combat of the Germanic tribe over the Romans.
